title: Korean BBQ Bowls
summary: Trending Korean-style bowls with marinated meat and pickled vegetables.
instructions: Marinate beef in soy sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, and garlic for 15 minutes.
Mix carrot and cucumber with rice vinegar and a pinch of salt. Let pickle for 10 minutes.
Heat a pan over high heat and cook marinated beef for 3-4 minutes.
Divide rice between bowls.
Top with cooked beef and pickled vegetables.
Drizzle with gochujang mixed with a little water.
Garnish with spring onions and sesame seeds.

title: Viral Pasta Chips
summary: The trending social media sensation - crispy baked pasta with seasoning.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C (200°C fan).
Cook pasta according to package instructions until very al dente.
Drain pasta and toss with olive oil.
Mix all seasonings together in a small bowl.
Spread pasta on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Sprinkle with seasoning mix and parmesan.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until golden and crispy.
Serve immediately with marinara sauce for dipping.

title: Cloud Bread Sandwiches
summary: Fluffy, low-carb cloud bread perfect for sandwiches.
instructions: Preheat oven to 150°C (130°C fan).
Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
In another bowl, mix egg yolks, cream cheese, baking powder, and salt.
Gently fold egg whites into yolk mixture.
Spoon mixture into 4 rounds on parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden.
Cool completely before using as sandwich bread.
Fill with your favorite sandwich ingredients.

title: Butter Board Platter
summary: Instagram-worthy butter board with herbs and fresh bread.
ingredients: 2 tbsp fresh herbs (rosemary, thyme, chives), chopped
instructions: Let butter come to room temperature until very soft.
Spread butter on a wooden board or large plate using an offset spatula.
Create swirls and patterns in the butter.
Sprinkle with chopped herbs, sea salt, and lemon zest.
Drizzle with honey in decorative patterns.
Add a few cracks of black pepper.
Garnish with edible flowers if using.
Serve with fresh bread slices for spreading.

title: Marry Me Chicken
summary: The viral creamy chicken recipe that's taking social media by storm.
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until golden. Remove and set aside.
Add garlic to the same pan and cook for 1 minute.
Pour in chicken stock and scrape up any browned bits.
Add cream, sun-dried tomatoes, Italian seasoning, and red pepper flakes.
Simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens slightly.
Return chicken to pan and cook for 5 more minutes.
Stir in parmesan and basil before serving.
